page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN RHYMNEY
page.content: It is a sad reality that this area has suffered more than most in terms of unemployment and a general decline in the infra-structure of the area.With any area of high unemployment, there are many associated problems,which are a direct result of such a state.It is evident that this area,so typical of the Welsh Valleys,is in a state of dis -enchantment.With the decline of the basic heavy industries ,iron,steel and coal on which the area was founded in the 19th Century,alternative employment was confined to a few large employers.With insufficient diversification,the closure of any one of these employers has had devastating effects on the community.The area is in a slow state of decline due mainly to a lack of industrial involvement and not to the efforts of the community at large.
